headline: China’s Markets Shed ‘Uninvestable’ Tag as Global Funds Return
summary: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said global hedge funds were last month the most active in onshore equities in recent years — a stark contrast to 2021, when some clients had deemed the market “uninvestable.”  Official data show foreign inflows rising across asset classes, a coordinated advance that’s only happened in three of the past 10 years.  Taken together, these are signs of a turnaround for a market that had fallen out of favor with global investors amid prolonged regulatory crackdowns and a spiraling property crisis.
